Title: The Russians are looking for deserters at the TOT of the Kherson region
Description: This is reported by the Center of National resistance In the region, there have been recorded cases of massive non-compliance with orders by subordinates due to low morale and alcohol abuse. As a result, the occupation command made a decision to conduct police raids on abandoned settlements from the Russian Guard in order to find deserters. In case of detection of fugitives, they are thrown into meat assaults in other directions of the front. In this way, the enemy intimidates the personnel and maintains discipline. However, practice shows that even such methods do not help. We remind you that border guards together with the police exposed a corruption scheme organized by an active serviceman who promised to place a conscript in a -warm- military service for $5,000 service, avoiding the war zone.

Title: Oleksandr Syrsky awarded the artillery soldiers who are fighting in Kurshchyna
Description: This is stated in a message on the page on Facebook. -He presented the artillery soldiers with state awards and departmental awards and congratulated them on their professional holiday. Thank you for the courage, resilience and heroism that they show every day defending the state, destroying the enemy's armored vehicles and personnel on his land,- Oleksandr Syrskyi said. He emphasized that thanks to the Ukrainian soldiers in the Kursk region, it was possible to destroy the aggressor's plans to attack the Sumy direction from the Kursk region and transfer this war to the enemy's territory. As reported by ArmyInform, on December 4, on the occasion of the Day of Missile Troops and Artillery of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyi met with Ukrainian defenders and honored them with state awards. The President also noted two artillery brigades with the medal of honor -For courage and bravery-.

Title: 82% of EW assets were contracted by the Ministry of Defense in less than three months after codifica...
Description: About this notified the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov. -This allowed the Armed Forces of Ukraine to get new anti-UAV complexes, tactical EW, reconnaissance aircraft, deepstrike drones, attack kamikaze and copter-bombers without bureaucratic delays,- the minister noted. Rustem Umyerov reported that this year the Ministry of Defense has already allocated over 87 billion UAH for the purchase of drones, including 59 billion UAH for deepstrike drones. -By the end of the year, this amount will increase. Our task is to provide the army with high-quality drones and EW on time and in the right quantity. This is critically important for Ukraine's victory,- the minister concluded. As reported by ArmyInform, in 2025 for Ukrainian defenders supplies more than 30,000 DeepStrike attack drones.

Title: Due to colossal losses, the occupiers change their tactics in the Pokrovsky direction
Description: Mykola Koval, the head of the press service of the 14th Brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine -Chervona Kalina-, reported this on the -Suspilne.Novyny- broadcast. According to Mykola Koval, the enemy began to use less manpower. If earlier they could use only 50 people in one assault group in -roll-ups-, now a maximum of 10 soldiers attack. -It is already clear that they have suffered great losses, colossal, so they are changing tactics. The enemy continues to discover our weak points. Make a maximum concentration of assault groups in one place so that you can break through. But you can see that we have now stopped the active actions of the enemy in that direction,- said Mykola Koval. As ArmyInform wrote, in the Pokrovsky direction the enemy continues to press in the area of ​​Zhovte and Lysivka settlements.

Title: The Ministry of Defense named the type of troops that leads in the number of female military personn...
Description: About it in interview ArmyInform told Head of the Department of Humanitarian Support of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Diana Kopanytsia. According to her, the indicators are somewhat lower in the Air Force and Medical Forces, where the number of servicewomen in each branch exceeds 6,000. After all, we also have hundreds of women successfully serving and performing combat missions in the Special Operations Forces and the Unmanned Systems Forces,- Diana Kopanytsia shared the data. As reported by ArmyInform, in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, they told how many thousands of women on the frontline.

Title: Kharkiv region — counterattack on the occupiers, SSO captured Russians in Kursk region: stream from ...
Description: To do this, the special forces drove up in armored vehicles close to the high-rise building, pelted it with explosives and immediately left. The building exploded and buried the Russians under the rubble. SSO fighters entered enemy positions and captured 12 Russians, 17 more decided not to surrender, so they had to be liquidated. The video shows the work of soldiers of the 73rd Marine Center and the 6th Ranger Regiment during a raid on the Russians in the Kursk region. Operators of the -Rubizh- operational brigade tracked down and destroyed the Russians in the Limano-Kupian direction. Fighters intercepted a video signal from an enemy drone, which dropped ammunition on our positions, and returned to the base. With the help of the video, the National Guardsmen accurately determined the coordinates of the Russian position and sent FPV drones there. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters — Captain Artem Golub and Lieutenant Yevhen Nazarenko.

Title: Assault and sweep using the salami tactic: the GUR revealed unknown details of the mission in the Kh...
Description: This is stated in message GUR MOU. The units of active actions of the GUR of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Kraken, -Artan-, the International Legion, the Legion -Freedom of Russia- together with the fighters of the NSU and the Armed Forces of Ukraine knocked the enemy out of their positions with joint efforts. This operation forced the Russians to abandon the idea of ​​breaking through to Kharkiv and shelling the city with barrel artillery. The active phase of the operation took place according to the -salami tactic- - the advanced units of -Artan- and -Kraken- seized the first positions of the Russians and secured them. After that, the fighters of the International Legion, as well as the -LSR- brought their comrades from the -Charter- brigade to these positions, and the shock fists of the GUR went forward again. -The storming and clearing of some areas lasted an average of 3-4 days. Then it took about three days to gather forces, organize logistics and determine the next points on which we will strike. We scouted the situation, understood how many forces and means we needed to knock out the enemy, and then advanced again for several days,- said a special officer of the GUR MOU. The occupiers also had a system of underground passages and burrows in the area, which had to be stormed and cleared.

Title: The ZSU is introducing a new uniform for women: field, demi-season and winter
Description: About it in interview ArmyInform told Head of the Department of Humanitarian Support of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Diana Kopanytsia. -Every day, with the joint efforts of the Ministry of Defense and the General Staff, we are working to improve material support for female military personnel, and at the moment we have the following results in this direction. In December 2023, for the first time, female servicemen received 50,000 sets of summer field suits, which are made taking into account female anthropometric parameters. Such uniform samples contain structural elements that allow female servicemen to feel comfortable while performing tasks in field conditions and permanent deployment points,- said Diana Kopanytsia. According to her, field trials of demi-season uniforms for women are currently underway, and the first samples of winter uniforms are prepared for scientific and research tests. And during 2023, women's underwear was also tested, which in 2024 was supplied to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -The supplied underwear samples cover a wide range of sizes and have a comfortable cut that does not restrict movement and is suitable for use in full equipment during combat missions. Ultimately, in December 2023 and January 2024, the Ministry of Defense certified two bulletproof vests for female servicemen. Appropriate means of protection have an outwardly curved armor plate, narrowed shoulders and an extended bottom, which helps adjust the body armor to the anatomical features of a woman,- Diana Kopanytsia summarized. As ArmiyaInform wrote, in November 2024 it became known that the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine ->starts conducting military (experimental) tests of new winter clothing and underwear designed for military personnel taking into account anthropometric data.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi and Mark Rutte discussed the situation at the front and the supply of ammunition
Description: This was reported by /a> Office of the President. The head of state talked about the situation on the battlefield in general and in certain areas of Donetsk region, the course of operations in the Kursk region and the results of Ukraine's use of long-range capabilities provided by allies. The President emphasized that the uninterrupted supply of 155 mm caliber shells, weapons and military equipment from the announced support packages is important for the timely completion of combat brigades. Volodymyr Zelenskyi and Mark Rutte agreed to cooperate more actively with partners to implement the decisions of the Washington NATO summit regarding air defense systems and additional strengthening of Ukraine against Russian air terror in the winter. Separately, the head of state thanked the Secretary General of the Alliance for holding a meeting of the Ukraine-NATO Council at the level of foreign ministers in Brussels, all the signals about further military support for Ukraine and a clear understanding of the need for investments in the Ukrainian defense industry. The President emphasized the importance of inviting Ukraine to NATO. As ArmiyaInform reported, during a two-day ministerial meeting in Brussels of the countries of the North Atlantic Alliance discussed increasing aid to Ukraine against the background of Russian advance on the front.

Title: The defense forces of Ukraine will receive more than 30,000 DeepStrike attack UAVs in 2025
Description: This was announced on December 5 by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov. According to him, some of these UAVs were financed by international partners, having invested in the Ukrainian defense industry. These new-generation drones are capable of operating autonomously at long distances and hitting enemy targets with high precision. Rustem Umyerov noted that the Ministry of Defense continues to increase investments in the development of high-tech systems. This not only meets the needs of the front, but also supports the defense industry, creates jobs and develops Ukrainian technology. -Ukraine is changing the rules of the game on the battlefield thanks to innovative technologies! We demonstrate to the world: Ukraine is capable of innovation and technological independence,- he assured. The Minister of Defense emphasized that even in the conditions of war, Ukrainians are developing state-of-the-art production, strengthening defense capabilities. -Ukraine is creating a techno-army ready to defend itself with all available means. This is an important signal to our allies and the enemy: we are strong, innovative and invincible!- - he summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, President Zelensky declared that the main guarantor of the Stability Plan should be weapons - 30 thousand long-range drones, 3,000 cruise missiles and a wave of technological innovation.

Title: For $5,000, he promised -warm- military service, but he was caught in the act
Description: About this informs December 5 State Border Service of Ukraine. -Operative employees of the 9th Border Detachment named after the Sich Riflemen documented in the regional center the fact of criminal activity of a person who abused his influence to resolve the issue of military service,- the DPSU said. In particular, it was about ensuring the service of a conscript in a military unit that is not involved in the performance of tasks in the area of ​​active hostilities. -For his -services-, the man planned to receive a monetary reward in the amount of 5 thousand US dollars from the -client-. These funds were allegedly intended to be transferred to the employees of the military medical commission,- the border guards noted. The perpetrator was detained while receiving the first tranche of illegal profit in the amount of 3,000 US dollars. -He demanded and received money from a man of draft age, promising first a limited fitness for service, and then securing service in a rear unit. Currently, the suspect has been remanded in custody with the possibility of bail in the amount of 151,400 hryvnias,- the report said. The measures were carried out within the scope of accompanying criminal proceedings, initiated based on the materials of operatives of the border agency under Art. 369-2 of the CCU -Abuse of influence-. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Intense battles: 106 clashes have been recorded at the front since the beginning of the day
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 16 :00 December 5. Border settlements continue to suffer from shelling from the territory of the Russian Federation. Areas of settlements of Krasnopill, Pokrovka and Demyanivka in Sumy region were affected by barrel artillery fire. In addition, the enemy carried out an airstrike with a KAB on Glukhov. In the Kupyan direction Ukrainian soldiers repulse three enemy attacks in the direction of Nova Kruglyakivka and Lozova. One attack has already been repelled. Petropavlivka and Lozov were hit by airstrikes by the National Army. On the Kharkiv direction, the Russian occupiers carried out an airstrike with a KAB in the Krugli area. On the Lymansky direction during the day, the invading army carried out 12 assaults and offensive operations near Grekivka, Tverdokhlibovo, Yampolivka, Terni, Zarichny, Torsky and in Serebryansk Forestry. Currently, four clashes are still ongoing. In the Kramatorsk direction, our defenders repulse the enemy's assault near Chasovoy Yar. In the direction of Toretsk Defense forces repelled one attack near Toretsk. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the day, the occupiers have made 26 attempts to dislodge our defenders from their positions in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Dachenske, Zhovte, Pushkine, Novotroitske, Shevchenko, Novopustinka settlements. The defense forces are holding back the onslaught and repulsed 18 enemy attacks. 8 clashes are still ongoing. In the Kurakhiv direction, the occupiers conducted 35 attacks near Berestki, Stary Terni, Zori, Sontsivka, Kurakhovo, Dalnyi, Elizavetivka, Hanivka, Romanivka, and Uspenivka. Ten clashes have been ongoing so far. In the Vremivsk direction, our defenders repelled enemy attacks fifteen times near Kostyantynopolsky, Rozlyv, Suhy Yali, Makarivka and Novodarivka, ten of them are still ongoing. In the Orikhov direction, our defenders repelled the enemy attack in the direction of Novodanilivka. In the Siversky, Gulyaipilsky and Dnipro directions at this time of the day, the enemy did not conduct active operations. In Kurshchyna Ukrainian defenders repelled seven enemy attacks, fighting continues in four more locations. In general, last day losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1,580 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 13 tanks, 22 armored combat vehicles, 21 artillery systems, 31 operational-tactical UAVs, 97 units of automobile equipment and 2 units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: 15 years in prison: six citizens who fought against the Defense Forces of Ukraine were sentenced
Description: This is stated in the message of the Prosecutor General's Office. It has been proven that in January 2022, a resident of Luhansk voluntarily joined the Russian army, receiving the position of an armored personnel carrier gunner. He was engaged in the construction of defense structures and the protection of warehouses with ammunition. Later, five more citizens from Luhansk region and Donetsk region joined the army of occupiers, in particular, a former prisoner who signed a contract with the occupiers while in Makiivka correctional colony. All six took part in military operations against the Armed Forces of Ukraine. They built fortifications, guarded warehouses with ammunition, delivered them to positions and took direct part in the battles in Luhansk region, in particular near Vrubivka, and in Donetsk region - in the area of Avdiivki, the villages of New York, Berestov, Klishchiivki, Verkhnyotoretskoho. The men were detained by the Ukrainian military in August-October 2024. They were in custody until the verdicts were announced.

Title: More than 1,000 women in the Armed Forces have been awarded state awards
Description: About it in interview ArmyInform told Head of the Department of Humanitarian Support of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Diana Kopanytsia. -The number of female servicemen in leadership positions is almost 7,000, and this number shows a gradual trend towards growth,- Diana Kopanytsia said. More than 1,000 servicewomen have been awarded state awards and more than 18,000 have already received combatant status. We remind you that ArmyInform reported that at military universities this year the most popular specialties and specializations among women were by which commanders of mechanized units, units of Airborne Assault Forces and Special Operations Forces are trained.

Title: He restored communication on the occupied railway — a collaborator from the Kupyan region was taken ...
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. According to the investigation, during the forcible seizure of Kupyan Oblast by the armed forces of the Russian Federation, the suspect, who before the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation worked on the railway, voluntarily decided to work for the enemy. At the beginning of July 2022, the man, having relevant work experience and relevant professional skills, assumed the position of -head of the communication section of the shop- in the so-called -SE -Kupyanskaya zheleznaya doroga-. Using the material resources and capacities of the Ukrainian enterprise, the collaborator ensured the uninterrupted operation of the occupation railway. Acting in the interests of the enemy, the man organized and directly performed repair work related to the establishment and restoration of all types of communications. By his actions, the suspect helped the enemy to unhindered transport military equipment, ammunition and personnel from the Russian Federation to the temporarily occupied Ukrainian territories with the help of railway transport. The law enforcement officers collected the necessary evidence base and exposed the collaborator. At the request of the prosecution, the suspect was remanded in custody without bail. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that at dawn servicemen of the Kodim border service department of the Podilsk detachment discovered a group of people who tried to illegally cross the border with Moldova.

Title: Strengthening the Defense Forces: Ukraine and Norway intensify cooperation
Description: This is stated in message MoU. During the meeting, he spoke about the situation at the front, about Russia's daily shelling of the Ukrainian energy system with attack drones, cruise missiles and ballistic missiles. Lieutenant General Ivan Havryliuk named the critical needs of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. He also informed about the increasing support of the Russian Federation by the DPRK. It is not only about new supplies of ammunition and missiles. And about the increase in the number of North Korean troops near the borders of Ukraine. -The enemy is constantly changing the terror tactics of Ukraine. Ahead is a difficult winter period, which the aggressor will use to plunge our country into darkness and cold. We must quickly strengthen the capabilities of our air defense and replenish the stock of missiles to the existing systems. The Kremlin's desire for escalation should receive a consolidated response from our partners,- Ivan Gavryliuk emphasized. The representative of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Kingdom of Norway, Colonel Kjell Hauan, noted that supporting Ukraine is one of Norway's priorities. The participants of the Norwegian delegation assured of further active assistance within the framework of the Capability Coalitions. The parties agreed on steps to intensify cooperation in the production of certain types of weapons. The First Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine also emphasized the need to focus efforts on solving the task of equipping the units that are currently being formed with armored vehicles. As ArmiyaInform reported, Ivan Gavrylyuk discussed with the delegation of the British government new opportunities for cooperation in the field of defense industry, localization of production of defense products and use of revenues from frozen Russian assets.

Title: Reform of the food system of the Armed Forces: a pilot project will start in 2025
Description: About this informs December 5 Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. Next year, the procurement agency of the DOT will ensure the purchase of food products for the Armed Forces of Ukraine, both under the current model and under the pilot model. -The essence of the innovation is that the selection of manufacturers will take place for individual groups of goods through public procurement platforms, and further shipment of products through the distribution centers of suppliers,- the statement said. The total expected value of contracts for the first half of 2025 is more than UAH 3 billion. -The reform of the food system of the Armed Forces reaches a new level. The announcement of tenders under the pilot model for 2025 is an important step towards raising quality standards and supply efficiency. We are implementing a modern approach that should improve reliability, transparency and compliance with the needs of our military,- said Deputy Defense Minister of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. According to him, the new mechanism will cover five regions and the city of Kyiv and will become a testing ground for large-scale changes in the future. First, the innovation will make it possible to control the quality of goods even before they go directly to the military. Second, it will allow open pricing for items most sensitive to value and quality. -The decision on the further deployment of the pilot project will be made based on the results of the first three months of its operation,- the MOU said. As reported by ArmyInform, the State Rear Operator of the Ministry of Defenseannounceda tender for the purchase of bottled water for the Ukrainian military for the first half of 2025.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi called for active actions to free Ukrainians from Russian captivity
Description: He mentioned this in his Telegram channel. In his address, the head of state noted the world's insufficient reaction to Russia's crimes, in particular regarding the treatment of Ukrainian prisoners, the abduction of children, and destruction in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine. -We see how little the world reacts to what is being done to Ukrainian prisoners in Russia, and how few voices speak about kidnapped Ukrainian children. There is almost no reaction to what our occupied territories have turned into due to the Russian presence,- the head of state emphasized. The President thanked everyone who has already joined the work to restore human rights and peace in Ukraine, calling on the international community to be more active. -I ask everyone to be tireless and to involve in this work those who are still on the sidelines. States, organizations, leaders and communities that can help save people and ensure moral responsibility for Russia's crimes,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. As reported by ArmyInform, the President of Ukraine noted the importance of volunteers in the fight for the country's future.

Title: They have built logistical chains of people: the Russians have created a huge conveyor belt of death...
Description: Oleksandr Borodin, spokesman, told about this on the air of the -Edyny Novyni- telethon Third Assault Brigade. According to Oleksandr Borodin, the enemy clearly set the task of reaching the Oskil River. Another goal is the city of Borova. This is a common goal of invaders - such logistics centers are very important for the Russians. -They chose the tactics of daily assaults for the constant fatigue of our personnel. But if there is a possibility of rotation, and there are forces and means to ensure these rotations, it is possible to be in such conditions for a long time and protect people,- Oleksandr Borodin noted. The situation is extremely difficult. The occupiers have no problems with reserves, the spokesman of the Third Assault Division points out. The quality of training has fallen, but the infantry, albeit untrained, is sufficient. -They have built logistics chains of people. When one company is destroyed there, there is conditionally another, which stands on the second line of defense. And the third company, which is in the rear area,- said Oleksandr Borodin. How reported ArmyInform, in Kharkiv Oblast, the occupiers are digging underground cities to escape from Ukrainian FPV drones.

Title: In the Russian Federation, they are beginning to involve children in harmful industries
Description: About this informs the Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. The Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation believes that these changes -will allow enterprises to conclude agreements on paid internships with students of professional educational organizations.- In fact, the goal of such innovations is the desire of the Russian government to solve the problem of labor shortages, primarily at military-industrial complex enterprises. Such a deficit arose in the context of the war against Ukraine, mobilization and attempts to increase the volume of production of weapons and other military products. During the first half of this year, Russian employers sent job invitations to more than 3 million people aged 14 to 18. Propaganda of the Russian Federation tries to justify the involvement of teenagers in hazardous work with examples from the Second World War and the thesis that -work even in hazardous industries is safer for children than being on the street.- The actions of the Russian authorities once again proved the readiness of the Kremlin not to reckon with its own people, in particular with the interests of children, for the sake of aggressive goals in Ukraine.

Title: Military cars and administrative buildings were set on fire: five citizens were notified of suspicio...
Description: This is stated in message of the SBU. Among the participants: recidivists and unemployed seekers of -easy- money in Telegram channels. On the order of the occupiers, they tried to destroy two military vehicles and an administration building with the help of flammable mixtures. A 24-year-old resident of the capital, who previously served a prison term for drug trafficking, robbery and fraud, was arrested in Kyiv region on hot pursuit. After his release, he cooperated with the occupiers and agreed to perform a -test- task: to burn an SUV of the Armed Forces. Immediately after committing a new crime, he was detained by law enforcement officers. Two more suspects were found in one of the villages of Fastiv district, where they rented an apartment. Both were detained immediately after they set fire to an official SUV of the Air Force assault troops returning from the front line. They recorded the car fire on mobile phone cameras and sent a corresponding -report- to their Russian curator. According to the investigation, the perpetrators arrived in the capital region from Donetsk region as immigrants three years ago. One of them was already charged with robbery in 2018. In the Ternopil region, law enforcement officers detained two local residents, aged 20 and 23, who tried to destroy the administrative building of the village council near the regional center. First, the perpetrators broke the window of the state institution, and then poured a flammable mixture into the premises and set it on fire. Based on all the revealed facts, the detainees were notified of suspicion (according to the crimes committed) under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: The suspects are in custody. They face up to 10 years in prison.

Title: The occupiers threw away FPV drones with their hands, threw machine guns at them and pretended to be...
Description: They published a video of combat work on December 5 on their channel. -The orcs try to shoot down the drones with their machine guns, pretend to be dead, pretend to be a tree and think that you can just throw away the ephivishka that didn't detonate immediately. But, fortunately, nothing helps them,- Ukrainian soldiers commented. Earlier, ArmyInform showed how fighters of the battalion of unmanned systems of the 63rd mechanized brigade -dron/->hit the occupier, who was carrying canisters with fuel.

Title: The Armed Forces said how many thousands of women are on the front lines
Description: About it in interview ArmyInform told Head of the Department of Humanitarian Support of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Diana Kopanytsia. Thus, as of October, the total number of women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine was almost 69,000, of which more than 48,000 were military personnel. -On the other hand, in January 2022, on the eve of a large-scale invasion, the total number of women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine was more than 52,000,- said Diana Kopanytsia. According to her, more than five and a half thousand women soldiers are currently on the front line. Let us remind you that on November 17, the anti-aircraft gunner of the anti-aircraft missile unit of the Galicia-Volyn radio engineering brigade Natalia Grabarchuk destroyed a MANPADS cruise missile -Needle-. It was her first combat launch and first hit.

Title: The forces of unmanned systems hit the Tor-M2 air defense system combat vehicle
Description: This was reported by the press service of the Unmanned Systems Forces. -BM 9A331M2 Tor-M2 is capable of firing on the move, without stopping, has an increased ammunition and is equipped with modern missiles that provide an extended target area and increased accuracy,- the message reads. The cost of the unit is estimated at approximately 27 million US dollars. As reported by ArmyInform, operators of the 73rd Marine Center and the 6th Ranger Regiment during a raid on enemy positions in the Kursk region destroyed 17 enemies and another 12 were captured.

Title: -Magnificent seven- on the border with Moldova: a drone intercepted an interesting company of violat...
Description: This is informed by /a> State Border Service of Ukraine. The movement of seven people heading to the state border was recorded by the operator of an unmanned aerial vehicle. Violators were detained near the border in the Podilsky district of the Odesa region. As it turned out, residents of Kyiv, Zhytomyr, Odesa, Kherson and Sumy regions tried to enter Moldova illegally. Their actions were coordinated by the Telegram channel administrator, who remotely managed the group. For a successful transfer, each of the detainees had to pay the organizer 3,000 USD. Administrative protocols were drawn up against the detained violators under Article 204-1 of the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses. The cases have been referred to the court. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: The President of Ukraine noted the importance of volunteers in the fight for the country's future
Description: He wrote about this on social networks on December 5. -Ukrainians from all parts of our country, friends from many countries, caring hearts that overcome everything. Today is International Volunteer Day. People who unite others and thereby help save everyone. I am grateful to everyone who helps our army, our people throughout this war,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy emphasized. Formerly the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov thankedvolunteers for tireless work, big hearts, indomitable faith in victory and assured that they have become a real support for our country. As reported by ArmyInform, the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, General Oleksandr Syrskyi congratulated Ukrainian volunteers on International Volunteer Day. In his address, he emphasized the important role of the volunteer movement in supporting the Ukrainian army.

Title: Organization of the resistance movement and internal control: the Ministry of Defense approved new m...
Description: The relevant order -On the approval of changes to the List of military accounting specialties of officers and the List of military accounting specialties, according to which the primary military rank of reserve junior lieutenant can be assigned- No. 691 dated 15.10.2024 year has already been entered into the Unified State Register of Regulatory Acts. In particular, new specialties have appeared: For example, there is no longer a -Political Science- specialty. Instead, -Moral support- was added. Some other accounting specialties of this group have received name changes. For the most part, the emphasis is on the organization of psychological support for personnel (psychological support). The full list of changes can be found in the document itself. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov signed the order, which introduces a new full-time position in each brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — the authorized officer for procurement of goods, works and services

Title: Enemy troops attacked Chernihiv region, there is destruction
Description: informs the head of Chernihiv OVA Vyacheslav Chaus about this. -At night, the air-raid alarm sounded again. The enemy attacked Chernihiv Oblast. Previously, -Shakhedami-. It is known about the destruction in the village of Koryukiv district,- the message reads. According to Vyacheslav Chaus, the occupiers damaged the windows, doors and roof of a private house, as well as a barn. -Fortunately, no casualties. russia is a terrorist. Terrorists must be destroyed,- he emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, on the night of December 5, 2024, the enemy -oblastyah/->strike on Dniprovshchyna with two Iskander-M ballistic missiles from the Rostov region, also attacked Ukraine with 44 Shahed-type attack UAVs and other types of drones (launch areas: Orel, Kursk - Russian Federation).

Title: A complete failure - the fighters are left to survive without food and water: the attacks of the Rus...
Description: The spokesman of the operational and strategic group of troops -Khortytsia- lieutenant colonel Nazar Voloshyn. According to Nazar Voloshyn, everyone is thrown to storm. There is information about female stormtroopers. -For the most part, in the occupation army, women are recruited as medical personnel in the communication and supply units. Recently, they have been spotted taking part in some storm action. These are former prisoners, convicts from the -Storm- units,- said Lieutenant Colonel Nazar Voloshyn. The spokesperson of the Khortytsia operational-strategic grouping of troops notes that the attitude of the Russian leadership towards attack aircraft is a one-time waste. -Russian servicemen, especially from front-line units, complain about logistical support. They lack ammunition, food and water. This all became a pressing issue. The complete failure of the Russian army - the soldiers are left to survive without food and water,- said Nazar Voloshyn. As reported by /a> The Army informs that on the Eastern Front the enemy is -burning- strategic reserves in attacks - the most difficult on Pokrovsky, Kurakhiv and Vremiv directions.

Title: Organization of the resistance movement, moral support and internal control: the Ministry of Defense...
Description: The relevant order -On the approval of changes to the List of military accounting specialties of officers and the List of military accounting specialties, according to which the primary military rank of reserve junior lieutenant can be assigned- No. 691 dated 15.10.2024 year has already been entered into the Unified State Register of Regulatory Acts. In particular, new specialties have appeared: For example, there is no longer a -Political Science- specialty. Instead, -Moral support- was added. Some other accounting specialties of this group have received name changes. For the most part, the emphasis is on the organization of psychological support for personnel (psychological support). The full list of changes can be found in the document itself. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov signed the order, which introduces a new full-time position in each brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — the authorized officer for procurement of goods, works and services

Title: They can put a battalion literally behind one house: the enemy is trying to press -with meat-
Description: This was told by the spokeswoman of Luhansk OTU on the broadcast of the -Edyny Novyni- telethon - Major Anastasia Bobovnikova. According to Anastasia Bobovnikova, the Russian army leadership considers its people expendable material that can be spent without limit. -They lose a mechanized battalion in a week, it's only in Toretsk alone. Yes, they are making progress, but very slowly. They can literally put an entire mechanized battalion behind the house,- the spokeswoman said. In place of the destroyed stormtroopers, others come. The offensive, says Anastasia Bobovnikova, is ongoing. -Unfortunately, they have a large resource of this meat. If the technique is used less in this area, then there is a lot of human resources there. With an emphasis on the word -very,- said the spokeswoman of Luhansk OTU. Previously ArmyInform reported that in the city of Toretsk, the week of urban battles is postponed in the Russian army of occupation up to half a thousand people.

Title: In Kurshchyna, the rangers captured 12 Russian marines and destroyed another 17
Description: published a video of combat work on their Special Operations Forces channel on December 5. In the video, the prisoners of war said that they were from the 810th Marine Brigade of the Russian Federation. Earlier, ArmiyaInform showed how the soldiers of the 6th Ranger Special Operations Forces regiment together with the adjacent units of the Defense Forces replenish the exchange fund in Kurshchyna, in particular, during aerial reconnaissance, the BPAK operatorsdiscovered 30 enemy infantrys, who made their way to the position in two groups. Also operators of the 73rd maritime center of the SSO carried out a raid on enemy positions in the Kursk region and successfully replenished the exchange fund with four servicemen of the Russian Federation.

Title: Escape in flippers: a Russian agent was building schemes for evaders
Description: informs the Security Service of Ukraine about this. It is noted that the 52-year-old resident of the Zhytomyr region, a former representative of the banned Derzhava party, was remotely recruited by the Kremlin's special services. At the behest of the FSB, he created a network of Telegram channels, where he provided conscripts with instructions to avoid mobilization, suggesting escape routes through forests and reservoirs outside checkpoints. The detainee was engaged in reconnaissance of border areas, marked routes on maps and handed them over to clients. After fleeing to the Russian Federation, he planned to participate in information and psychological operations against Ukraine, appearing on the airwaves of Russian propaganda media to discredit Ukrainian state institutions. SBU investigators informed the detainee of the suspicion for h. 2 Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason under martial law). He faces up to life in prison with forfeiture of property. Previously, his actions were qualified as: Operative measures were carried out by SBU employees in Chernihiv region together with the State Border Service under the procedural guidance of the Chernihiv regional prosecutor's office. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Numerous victims and large-scale destruction: the Russians do not stop shelling Donetsk region
Description: This was reported by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. Pokrovskyi district: Kramatorskyi district: Bakhmutskyi district: As a result of shelling, 237 people were evacuated, including 13 children. Work to eliminate the consequences of the attacks continues. As reported by ArmyInform, in Kharkiv Oblast through Russian shelling is new destruction and victims.

Title: -Shortening their age is the easiest way for them to end the war-: Russian attack aircraft en masse ...
Description: Yuriy Syrotyuk, the main a fire support company sergeant in the 5th Separate Assault Brigade. According to Yuriy Syrotyuk, well-constructed defenses make it possible to deter the enemy's daily attacks, but the enemy continues to throw infantrymen into -meat assaults-. -Sometimes it's surprising how mercilessly they use their infantry… They go into battle under the compulsion of death. They go without proper support. Imagine their psychological state. Therefore, it is clear that for many of them, shortening their age is the easiest way to end the war,- Yuriy Syrotyuk noted. How reported ArmyInform, in the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy continues to concentrate its main efforts around the city of Chasiv Yar, but the Defense Forces maintain their positions

Title: Over 120 novelties for the front: Ukraine is expanding its arsenal of weapons
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. In the list of codified OVT novelties in November, the most are unmanned aircraft complexes, ammunition (mainly UAVs), engineering means, EW/PER means, and communication. Most of them are also of Ukrainian design. In addition, the list of new anti-terrorist weapons, which were approved for use during November, includes new mobile rocket launchers (for individual units of the Defense Forces), a new armor-piercing cartridge, a sanitary-evacuation armored car of domestic production, etc. -Such a number of new codified samples of anti-aircraft weapons in just one month testifies to the significant dynamics of weapons development in Ukraine by individual nomenclature. Individual samples of Ukrainian weapons have unique characteristics. We are working to ensure that they end up with our military as soon as possible,- said Deputy Defense Minister of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. As reported by ArmyInform, The Ministry of Defense allowed the use of JCB HMEE excavators in troops.

Title: The President of Ukraine signed a decree on sanctions against the pro-Russian government of Georgia
Description: The President told this in his address on December 5. -These are sanctions against that part of the government now in Georgia, which is handing over Georgia to Putin. It is important that partners also now talk about their position, honestly declare what is happening. And we need to act,- he declared. According to him, this is what happens in international affairs: if you do not react in time, then decades will be lost, and countries will be deprived of their freedom. -You cannot lose anyone in this region - neither Georgia, nor Moldova, nor Ukraine. We must defend ourselves against Moscow together. Ukraine applied sanctions against Ivanishvili and his accomplices — 19 people. It is those who sell the interests of Georgia and the people. And we call on Europe, America, everyone in the world to act in the same way - to act on principle,- he stressed. Previously, Volodymyr Zelensky reported that the authorities in Georgia are pushing the country into obvious dependence on Russia. He noted that Ukraine's legal response to the events in Georgia is being prepared and work is underway with Europeans and other partners on specific actions.

Title: In the Kharkiv region, new destruction and victims appeared due to Russian shelling

At 6:25 p.m. in the city of Kupyansk, the enemy damaged private houses as a result of shelling with guided aerial bombs. A 40-year-old man died. Two women aged 40 and 69 were also injured. Around 4:00 p.m., a private house was partially damaged in the village of Oleksandrivka, Zolochiv community, Bogodukhiv district, due to an unidentified drone strike. At 11:50 in Kupyansk, a Russian FPV drone hit a civilian car at the entrance to the city. As a result of the explosion, a 65-year-old man was injured. During the day, 72 people were evacuated from the Borivskyi and Kupyanskyi directions. Title: The forests burned, the mines stopped: the occupiers justify the failures in the Luhansk region
Description: This was reported by the head of the Luhansk OVA, Artem Lysohor. However, the real consequences of the activities of Russian investors, who received mines in the region back in February, remain doubtful. Among the -results- of the work are mass layoffs, salary delays, and dismantling of equipment. Meanwhile, the occupying authorities of Luhansk region blame the destruction of 4.3 thousand hectares of forests around Stanytsia Luhanska solely on climatic conditions. The local forest farm claims that the cause of the fires was an increase in air temperature. Other factors - the lack of preventive measures, the shortage of extinguishing agents and rescuers - are not taken into account by the occupiers. As well as the failure of the disaster relief campaign. Residents of the affected settlements, whose houses burned down, were mostly forced to evacuate on their own. Rescue units of the occupiers did not arrive at the site, leaving people to fight the fire alone. The situation in the occupied Luhansk region demonstrates that real assistance to the population and solving environmental problems remain on the margins of the occupation administration's attention. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupying authorities of Luhansk region intensified forced mobilization, directing efforts to attract young people to the army of the Russian Federation. Workers of military commissariats carry out inspections in public places and at addresses, forcing conscripts to sign contracts, bypassing their military service.

Title: The Netherlands will provide an additional 22 million euros to strengthen Ukrainian air defense
Description: reported this by the head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands Caspar Veldkamp following the results of the two-day NATO ministerial meeting in Brussels . -At the meeting of the Ukraine-NATO Council, I emphasized the importance of strengthening the military potential of Ukraine,- the message reads. He added that Russia's actions directly threaten NATO through massive military buildup, airspace incursions, and acts of sabotage. -At the meeting of the North Atlantic Council in Brussels, I emphasized that we must step up our efforts to confront this reckless and destabilizing behavior,- he noted. The minister emphasized that it is also necessary to pay attention to third countries that help the Russian war machine. -This requires a tougher and more coordinated response from NATO and allies. First of all, we must stay the course when it comes to supporting Ukraine. There is simply no alternative,- he emphasized. Today, on International Volunteer Day, I want to address those who have become a real support for our country. You are our staunch allies. Your strength is in the actions that are not seen by the cameras, but are felt by our soldiers. Thanks to you, our army is stronger and our frontline is secure,- he declared. Rustem Umyerov emphasized that every camouflage net, every trench candle, every repaired drone is the daily work of volunteers, their contribution to victory. -You find ways to solve problems where it seems impossible. You are not afraid of distances, difficulties and dangers. The volunteer movement is not just about helping. It is a symbol of Ukrainian unity. A symbol of the fact that in the struggle for freedom each of us is ready to do everything possible and impossible. Kudos to our volunteers,- he concluded. Title: Propagandists attack the computer game: what they invented this time
Description: According to the propagandists, the game allegedly collects players' personal data, such as IP addresses, names, locations, even without their consent, passing this information to Ukrainian military commissariats. This fake was accompanied by the use of the Wired logo, which was supposed to give the information the appearance of authenticity. Propagandists also claim that the studio received funding from the Ukrainian government in exchange for such activities. About this writes Center for Strategic Communications and Information Security. In fact, the GSC Game World studio raised significant funds ($800,000) for the support of the Armed Forces with the help of crowdfunding and donated them to the Ukrainian charity -Return Alive-. In response, Russia started a campaign against the game, including statements about its possible ban. This case is another example of the spread of disinformation aimed at discrediting Ukrainian achievements, particularly in the field of video games. It's also a continuation of a campaign similar to Netflix's previously documented fake trailer disinformation campaign dubbed -Matryoshka-. The main goal of such fakes is to undermine trust in Ukraine and its initiatives on the world stage. Eugene Bouquet

Title: Is there gender equality in the military: about the number of women in the army, body uniform and NA...
Description: The ArmiyaInform correspondent asked Diana Kopanytsia, the head of the Department of Humanitarian Support of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, about all this and more. — Ms. Diana, can you provide statistics on women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine? How many in total are in the ranks of the Armed Forces as of the beginning of December 2024, of which there are military personnel? What are the statistics on women in genera and species (number of women)? — Over the past three years, the number of women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, compared to the data before the beginning of the large-scale invasion, has increased by more than 20%. As of October, the total number of women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine was almost 69,000, of which more than 48,000 were military personnel. Instead, in January 2022, on the eve of a large-scale invasion, the total number of women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine was more than 52,000. Currently, more than 5,500 women soldiers are on the front line. Among women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we now also have more than 10,000 officers, more than 13,000 sergeants, more than 23,000 soldiers and more than 1,500 cadets. The number of female servicemen in leadership positions is almost 7,000, and this figure shows a gradual trend towards growth. More than 1,000 servicewomen have been awarded state awards and more than 18,000 servicewomen have already received combatant status. As for the information in the breakdown of the number of women by military branch, the largest number of women is usually in the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as the largest branch of the military, where more than 18,000 women serve. The figures are somewhat lower in the Air Force and Medical Forces, where the number of women in each branch exceeds 6,000 servicemen. A fairly significant number of female military personnel is also observed in the Territorial Defense Forces, Support Forces and Logistics Forces, and the Naval Forces. After all, we also have hundreds of women successfully serving and performing combat missions in the Special Operations Forces and the Unmanned Systems Forces. — Ukrainian servicemen appeal attentionthat sexism in the army is a widespread phenomenon and lack of material support is one of its manifestations. In particular, it is about the form according to the size and shape of the body, anatomical body armor, underwear, etc. What coordinate system are we currently in to correct this situation? What is your administration doing for this? — Prior to the start of the large-scale invasion, security in the Armed Forces of Ukraine was predominantly male-oriented. In particular, at the level of regulatory documents of the Ministry of Defense, only a single uniform standard was approved - men's. The women's uniform was provided only for the formal one - a petticoat, a skirt and high-heeled shoes. There were also no requirements for personal protective equipment and other tactical items for female servicemen. This created problems for female military personnel, who were forced to wear men's uniforms that did not meet their physiological needs and anthropometric parameters. The situation with the material support of female servicemen in the Armed Forces of Ukraine is not ideal, but it has positive dynamics. Every day, with the joint efforts of the Ministry of Defense and the General Staff, we work to improve the material support of female servicemen, and at the moment we have the following results in this direction. In December 2023, for the first time, female servicemen received 50,000 sets of summer field suits, which are made taking into account female anthropometric parameters. Such uniform samples contain structural elements that allow female servicemen to feel comfortable while performing tasks in field conditions and permanent deployment points. Field trials of the women's demi-season uniform are currently underway, and the first samples of the winter uniform are ready for research testing. During 2023, women's underwear was also tested, which in 2024 was supplied to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The supplied underwear samples cover a wide range of sizes, and also have a comfortable cut that does not restrict movement and is suitable for use in full equipment when performing combat tasks. Ultimately, in December 2023 and January 2024, the Ministry of Defense certified two bulletproof vests for female servicemen. The corresponding protective equipment has an outwardly curved armor plate, narrowed shoulders and an extended bottom, which helps to adjust the body armor to the anatomical features of a woman. — Where do you see a positive trend regarding gender policy in the Armed Forces during a large-scale war? Where is the critical situation, and where is the most needed point of effort? — A key achievement in ensuring gender equality in the Armed Forces of Ukraine is the removal of legal restrictions on the tenure of women in military positions. Since 2018, Ukraine has managed to significantly expand the range of combat positions for women: there are opportunities to be commanders of infantry units, female snipers, machine gunners, grenade launchers, scouts, and even drive armored vehicles or be a tank gunner. As of today, there are no regulatory obstacles to the occupation of positions by women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Women have the opportunity to serve in positions of their choosing, including typical combat specialties (recon, sniper, machine gunner, grenade launcher, gunner or UAV operator - ed.). And as practice shows, women in such positions are effective. At the same time, we periodically receive requests that, in fact, commanders do not admit female servicemen to combat positions, despite the high motivation of such women and the absence of objective obstacles to the performance of such tasks. We are working together with gender advisers and commanders of the types and separate branches of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to minimize such discrimination. — How do you cooperate with partners in the context of gender equality? What do they praise for, and what shortcomings do they point to? — Cooperation with international partners is one of the main areas of activity of the Office, as the direction of gender equality is an important direction. Most of the standards in the field of ensuring gender equality are borrowed from international documents in the field of human rights, as well as the practice of international courts. I also want to note the fruitful cooperation of the management with our Ukrainian partners and experts in the field of ensuring gender equality. Thus, during 2023-2024, more than 250 advisers on gender issues of the Ministry of Defense have already undergone educational training with the assistance of national and international public organizations. The Department also systematically and productively cooperates with the Government Commissioner for Gender Policy Kateryna Levchenko regarding the implementation of the -Women, peace, security- agenda. Thanks to the professional work of these organizations and experts, the advisers on gender issues had the opportunity to familiarize themselves with international approaches to the issues of preventing and combating manifestations of discrimination, gender-based and domestic violence, the foundations of international humanitarian law. - When we talk about -NATO's gender equality standards- - what exactly are we talking about? Explain in simple language. - Put simply, the NATO Gender Equality Standards are a set of rules, guidelines and principles that help ensure equal opportunities, in particular, for women and men in the armed forces of NATO member and partner countries. The goal of these standards is to create an environment where every service member, regardless of gender or gender identity, can fulfill their potential. At the same time, gender equality does not at all mean that we should allocate equal resources to meet the needs of women and men in the military, or fully equalize men and women in terms of rights and responsibilities during service. True gender equality involves the fair distribution of resources and the creation of equal conditions for people, taking into account their gender needs. After all, it is quite clear that the proper material support of a woman who performs combat tasks may require more resources than in the case of creating identical conditions for male servicemen. If we look at this issue from a practical perspective, then in this context we should also mention the initial requirements for the interoperability of Ukraine with NATO, which Ukraine must implement in the near future so that our Armed Forces can effectively interact with the military structures of the member countries of the Alliance and conduct joint military operations. Such requirements include, for example, the introduction of a clear system of gender advisers in the Ministry of Defense system, the removal of legal barriers that prevent the participation and representation of women in security and defense sector institutions, thematic training for gender advisers, the development of prevention policies and responding to sexual violence in the military, etc. — At the beginning of October 2024, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine announced that it plans to conduct a gender analysis and identify institutional obstacles to the implementation of equality programs in the ranks of the Armed Forces. As of the beginning of December - how are things going? - To begin with, it is worth finding out what gender analysis actually is. Simply put, it is the identification and assessment of barriers that exist in law or in practice that prevent equal rights and opportunities for service members because of their gender or gender identity. Gender analysis involves collecting and analyzing data (for example, the number of women and men in different units - ed.), identifying practices or rules that may create inequality (for example, women's limited access to certain military occupations), and ultimately, the preparation of recommendations or draft regulations designed to solve the identified problems. That is, effective gender analysis is a long and painstaking work that requires the processing of a large amount of diverse data. Another important area of ​​our work is the gender analysis of data on military positions held by women and the identification of barriers that prevent women from effectively performing their duties. Our strategic goal is to create all the necessary conditions for women to occupy leadership positions in the army, demonstrating their professional qualities and leadership skills. - What are you planning for 2025 in the context of gender policy in the Armed Forces? - One of the key priorities for the next year is the regulatory regulation of the status and powers of the gender advisor in the Ministry of Defense system in accordance with NATO standards and best practices. We will also continue the gender analysis of the current needs of female servicemen in the army and, based on its results, we will work on improving the physical and material support of female servicemen, in particular, in cooperation with international partners. And, as we have done this year, we will work hard to train our gender advisers so that they can get not only the legal status and powers written in the regulations, but also practical tools to carry out their daily activities, and in the future they can participate in joint operations involving NATO countries. A separate priority is for us to improve the language training of advisors on gender issues, because, as I mentioned earlier, gender issues are of a global nature and are based on international regulatory documents and NATO standards, most of which are written in English. Title: It was not necessary to go far: the Finnish army ordered new mobile 120-mm mortar systems from a loc...
Description: As stated in the release, disclosed by the manufacturing company on the occasion of the conclusion of the relevant contract, the new mortar system integrates traditional heavy mortar weapons into a modular carriage, which is then mounted on a military truck, reports ArmyInform. The mortar complex, codified by the Finnish Army as the 120 KRH M3, was developed by Patria for the Finnish Land Forces. TREMOS is a modular carriage with a fire control system and recoil compensators. It can use any traditional 120mm mortar and mount on 4×4/6×6/8×8 trucks that have the appropriate container -locks- to secure the cargo. In case of machine malfunction, the weapon can be quickly transferred to another chassis. The module does not require any preparation before firing and can fire directly from the chassis of the vehicle, which greatly increases the mortar's mobility. -Patria has increased the mobility of heavy mortars in excellent cooperation with the Finnish Army and the Finnish Defense Forces Logistics Command, creating a new weapon system,- said Jussi Järvinen, executive vice president of Patria's Finnish division. He emphasized the significant tests carried out and pointed to Patria's legacy of innovative mortar systems, such as the famous AMOS (Advanced Mortar System) and NEMO (New Mortar) turrets, which are the basis of TREMOS development. The artillery system, by its characteristics, does not differ in any way from a similar trailed mortar, which would work traditionally on the ground. The main goal of the project is to increase the survivability of the mortar units of the Finnish ground forces due to better mobility in the conditions of war with an enemy that conducts counter-battery warfare and actively uses reconnaissance and strike drones. The Finnish military command is convinced that in the future heavy mortars will play an increasingly important role in the composition of ground troops as the main means of defeating from closed positions. Currently, the country's ground forces plan to gain experience in the use of such systems on ordered pre-production samples, and later make a decision on possible additional purchases of 120 KRH M3 complexes. -The goal is to start training conscripts with the new mortars during 2026,- said Colonel Ari Lehmuslehti of the Ground Forces Headquarters of the Finnish Armed Forces. However, the experts of the IKK defense website Defense Express (DE) were quite skeptical about this choice of soldiers' weapons countries of Suomi. According to their conclusions, it is a standard 120-mm mortar with manual loading, which was installed on the chassis of a truck, added a digitalized guidance system and a hydraulic recoil absorption mechanism. -The choice of this system may be surprising, because Patria has a much more advanced NEMO, which has a perfect fire control system, the possibility of a -fire raid-, when several mines that were fired from the same vehicle on different trajectories arrive at the same target, and also even the possibility of shooting on the move. It is also worth adding about the mechanization of charging and the fact that it is an armored chassis compared to TREMOS. At the same time, if the wheeled chassis can be replaced by a tracked one, for example, for the US Army, the NEMO mortar system was installed on the AMPV chassis,- noted the IKK DE. It should be recalled that our editors told in detail in one of his previous articles on the NEMO armored mortar system. By chance remind that in the order of the Minister of Defense of Ukraine dated August 28, 2023 on acceptance for armament The 120-mm mortar M/41D, the developer and manufacturer of which is the Finnish company Patria, is indicated in the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation of regular samples of foreign weapons. In turn, the authors of the portal European Defense Review indicate that the Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Finland concluded the above contract for the supply of a pre-production batch of TREMOS modular mortar systems, which are expected to be delivered to the troops in 2025. The number of ordered units is not named, but the contact amount is €4.7 million. Patria presented this new weapon system at the Future Mortar Systems conference in London on October 29, 2024

Title: F-16 against Russian cruise missiles: how many air targets were shot down -Battle Falcons-
Description: Since then, Russia has launched three massive combined air and missile strikes on Ukrainian territory — one in late August and two in November. F-16s participated in repelling these large-scale attacks as an air defense tool. Official information on the effectiveness of the use of F-16s against Russian cruise missiles and attack UAVs was collected and the number of enemy air targets shot down by Ukrainian -Battle Falcons- was calculated by ArmyInform. Full statistical information on Russian cruise missiles and attack drones shot down by the F-16 has not been officially made public. Therefore, approximate calculations of enemy targets destroyed by the -Battle Falcons- can be made only on the basis of separate official reports of the Air Force and the General Staff, as well as statements of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. For the first time, F-16s demonstrated their high efficiency in Ukrainian skies during the repulse of a Russian air-missile strike on August 26, 2024. Then the enemy launched 127 missiles of various types and 109 Shahed-131/136 attack UAVs on the territory of Ukraine. It was shot down 201 air targets - 102 missiles and 99 attack UAVs. Unfortunately, the military pilot Oleksiy Mes with the call sign -Moonfish- died in an aerial battle. In the notification of his death, the Command of the Air Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine noted that during the repulsion of the Russian of a massive combined air and missile strike, the pilot destroyed three cruise missiles and one attack UAV Instead, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported, that -during the aerial combat, the F-16 aircraft demonstrated their high efficiency, four enemy cruise missiles were shot down by airborne weapons.- So, on August 26, 2024, F-16 fighters shot down at least four cruise missiles and one Shahed. Russia carried out the next large-scale combined air and missile attack on the objects of the energy sector of Ukraine with various types of air, land and sea-based missiles and Shahed type UAVs at night on November 17, 2024. Then, as reported President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi, F-16 pilots shot down about 10 enemy air targets. The Supreme Commander-in-Chief did not specify exactly which enemy aircraft the pilots of the Ukrainian -Fighting Falcons- destroyed, but their contribution was about 7% of all enemy air targets destroyed at that time. Finally, on the night of November 27-28, 2024, Russia struck Ukraine with 188 air strikes, including 91 missiles of various types and 97 Shahed attack UAVs. Among them the Defense Forces of Ukraine vorozhyh-bpla/->shot down 76 Kh-101/”Caliber- cruise missiles, 3 guided air missiles X-59/69 and 35 Shaheds. Seven enemy cruise missiles were destroyed by F-16 pilots. Volodymyr Zelenskyi reported this in an interview with the British broadcaster Sky News on November 29. -Seven cruise missiles were destroyed two nights ago. Seven missiles that flew over infrastructure, civilian infrastructure,- he said. Thus, for the second time, the President of Ukraine highly praised the effectiveness of F-16 fighter jets in repelling massive combined air and missile strikes from the Russian Federation. -How are the F-16s doing today? Very good. Great, for the most part,- he emphasized in an interview with Sky News. Also, Volodymyr Zelenskyi partially reported specific data on the effectiveness of the pilots of the -Fighting Falcons-, because it is not excluded that, in addition to cruise missiles, they also shot down several -Shakhed-. At the same time, the Head of State also noted the biggest problem of the F-16 as a Ukrainian air defense tool — their insufficient number. -We have very few F-16s,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in an interview with Sky News, emphasizing the need for the Defense Forces of Ukraine both for more of these fighters and for other types of modern weapons. However, despite their small numbers, the Ukrainian -Battle Falcons- undoubtedly proved their high efficiency as an air defense vehicle, destroying about 20 enemy air attack vehicles. Increasing the number of F-16s in the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine will be able to significantly improve this statistic.

Title: They are storming as if they want the attack aircraft to run out as soon as possible - the tactics o...
Description: Chief Sergeant Volodymyr of the 53rd Mechanized Brigade named after Prince Volodymyr Monomakh told on the ArmyTV stream about this. -There is an impression that the Russian leadership has a goal - to quickly wipe out their people, whom they send for meat. Then wait for some time, then type again and erase again. That is, they do not need to occupy some frontiers, but to put more of their people in,- said Volodymyr. As reported by ArmyInform, the 53rd brigade appealed to the servicemen who voluntarily left their units, with a call to return to service.

Title: The occupiers are preparing to launch fiber-optic drones at a distance of 15-20 kilometers
Description: About this on the ArmyTV stream, a serviceman of the 4th brigade of operational assignment of the National Guard -Rubizh- Andriy Otchenash, who is located in the Lymano-Kupian direction. -The adversary started using optical fiber. If you watch his telegram channels, the enemy says that he will use copters on fiber optics for 15-20 kilometers. This is a not very pleasant situation, because it will complicate our logistics, because EW devices do not work on fiber-optic drones,- said Andriy Otchenash. He also noted the progress of the Russians in the development of Lancet strike drones, as well as aircraft-type reconnaissance UAVs. -They don't stand still, and that's also a minus. But thanks to the fact that our guys are also trying to find a countermeasure, for example, knocking down their wings with epfivishkas, this nullifies the successes of the Russians,- noted Andriy Otchenash. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 4th battalion -Freedom Force- of the National Guard brigade -Rubizh- -motolyg/->spectacularly repulsed the desperate attack of the invaders.

Title: Stalin-era cannon and -lancets- — the occupiers assembled a special group against our artillery
Description: Major Ivan Dragan, Chief of Staff of Art Division 93 of the -Kholodny Yar- mechanized brigade, told on the ArmyTV stream about this. According to him, the enemy group includes pilots of reconnaissance UAVs, -lancets- and long-range M-46 guns, developed back in 1951. -Russian -lancets- work very clearly and mostly in tandem with artillery. If they find our firing positions, they launch the first -lancet-. Somewhere in 20-25 minutes, the second one flies, and then the counter-battery artillery, one or two long-range guns, or 2S19 or M-46 caliber 130 millimeters are connected,- said Ivan Dragan about the enemy's tactics. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of the Signum 93 unit of the mechanized brigade -Cold Ravine- spectacularly destroyed an enemy tank that advanced towards our positions.

Title: In Nikopol region, 20 enemy shellings occurred during the day, a woman died
Description: This was reported by the head of the Dnipropetrovsk Regional State Administration Serhiy Lysak. The occupiers killed an 88-year-old woman by striking Nikopol with a kamikaze drone. A 64-year-old man received a shrapnel wound and a bruise after being hit by a drone in Myrivska hromada. Russians targeted the district center, Marganetska, Mirivska and Pokrovsk communities. Attacked with kamikaze drones, artillery, and dropped ammunition from UAVs. Six private houses, two farm buildings, three greenhouses, and a gas pipeline were damaged. A company car and a passenger car were mutilated. As reported by ArmiyaInform, on December 4, the Russian military >carried out shelling of settlements in the Kherson region using artillery and drones.

Title: One UAZ and 4 fools — in Kurshchyna, our pilots recorded a comedy with Russians
Description: The video was released December 4 on the unit's channel. A car drove up to the hole where the occupiers were hiding. The Russians tried to load their comrade into it, who could not walk either because of injuries or because of alcohol intoxication. At that moment, the first arrival of our kamikaze drone took place, which broke through the Uaza roof. At this time, two Russians tried to pull up their non-walking comrade, but they did not succeed. Maybe also due to alcohol intoxication. Then the driver went down the slope. Down — not up, the Russians were able to get their comrade to the UAZ and load it. Everyone was going to leave, but the pride of the Russian automobile industry was stuck. The Russians tried to push when another drone arrived. Then the surviving Russians waved their hands, left the car with a non-walking comrade and went somewhere. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of The Ravens unit of the 129th brigade of the Territorial Defense Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces showed their next booty: 3 enemy armored personnel carriers and buggy.

Title: One person died as a result of the Russian bombing of Kupyansk
Description: This was reported in the evening of December 4 by the head of the Kharkiv Regional Military Administration Oleg Synegubov. According to his information, two women had an acute reaction to stress. At least five private houses were destroyed or damaged. Rescue services are working on the spot, the demolition of the debris is ongoing. According to preliminary data, the Russian army shelled the city with Uragan surface-to-air missiles. As reported by ArmyInform, in Kherson Oblast dead and nine injured due to Russian shelling.

Title: The head of the GUR reported to the President about the situation in Syria and Georgia
Description: The President spoke about this in his evening address. According to him, Kyrylo Budanov reported on Russian intentions for the near future and on the situation in Syria — how a change in the balance of forces in Syria can change global circumstances. -There was also a report on the situation in Georgia. And this in Georgia, of course, is not only a problem of one people and not only of our region - how today's authorities in Georgia are pushing the country to obvious dependence on Russia. It's just shameful what things they are going to now against their own people. And when Moscow praises this government in Georgia, it clearly outlines who they are currently working for in Tbilisi and for whom they are dispersing protests. Certainly not for Georgia,- noted Volodymyr Zelenskyi. He said that Ukraine's legal response to the events in Georgia is being prepared. We are also working with Europeans and other partners on specific actions. The President instructed to prepare relevant sanctions decisions. As reported by ArmyInform, President met with the Secretary General of the Council of Europe.

Title: Two artillery brigades received an honorary award -For courage and bravery-

The award -For Courage and Courage- was also awarded to the 15th separate -Black Forest- Artillery Reconnaissance Brigade of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Both brigades were awarded in order to honor the courage and heroism shown during the defense of the state sovereignty, independence, and territorial integrity of Ukraine. The medal of honor - the ribbon -For Courage and Courage- - is a collective award of military units. As ArmiyaInform reported, on December 4, on the occasion of the Day of Missile Troops and Artillery of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyi met with Ukrainian defenders and honored them with state awards.

Title: - And buy yourself a soldering iron - SBS told about the preparation of drones
Description: The video was released on December 4 on the SBS channel of the ZSU. They remind us that this is the first military branch in the world that uses air, sea surface and underwater, ground unmanned and robotic systems in its combat operations. Title: War crimes of the Russian Federation and the release of children deported by Russia: the President m...
